issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Zamasp on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with two mural elements; dot, crescent, dot, crescent above covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below crescent, pointing to the left; double pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing to the left behind the neck; pointing upwards; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; crescent on both shoulders; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast (varying decoration, see below); to the right small bust to the left; crown with two mural elements, crown cap, above dot, above korymbos; holding in left hand diadem ribbon with broad, ribbed ends, pointing downwards; rigged border
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of three elements; round altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; altar flames rendered as four tiers of four, three, two and one strokes respectively; star to the left of altar flames, crescent to the right; to the left and the right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Zamasp, right hand raised, both figures facing inwards; outlines of attendant’s bodies depicted with several minor strokes to the left and to the right; at 3 h mint signature, at 9 h date, ridged border
